feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued June 24 at 5:15AM AKDT until June 24 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of the southeast gulf coast including Klawock and Hydaburg. * WHEN...Until 10 AM AKDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:45AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT WAVE NEXT WEEK... Temperatures soar late this weekend and remain high into mid next week across the northern and central Inner Channels. A few temperature records could fall. The warmest days are expected to be Monday into Wednesday when temperatures swell well into the 80s. Conditions could feel muggy at times as well. With around 18
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:45AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...VERY WARM NEXT WEEK... Temperatures will soar this weekend with highs up to 75 to 85 degrees. The warmest days are expected to be Monday through Wednesday, although for the southern Panhandle including Ketchikan and Metlakatla, the warmest days will likely be Sunday through Tuesday. A few temperature records could fall.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Southern Inner Channels

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:45AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT WAVE NEXT WEEK... Temperatures soar this weekend and remain high well into mid next week in Hyder. The warmest days are expected to be Monday into Wednesday when temperatures could reach into the lower 90s. Conditions could feel muggy at times as well with a potential for thunder sometime next week. With around 18 hours of daylight per
entry.cap:areaDesc: Misty Fjords

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL MARINE LAYER FOLLOWED BY WARMER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES HEADING INTO NEXT WEEK... Warmer than normal temperatures are expected by late this weekend as temperatures rise by a couple degrees each day. The warmest days are expected to be early next week with highs in the mid 70s and continued dry conditions.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 24 at 2:51AM PDT until June 26 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON SATURDAY TO 11 PM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Hot conditions with high temperatures in the mid to upper 80s. Overnight low temperatures will only likely cool into the low 60s for many locations Saturday night into Sunday morning. This will pose a moderate risk of heat-related illness.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Coast; North Coast

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 24 at 2:51AM PDT until June 27 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON SATURDAY TO 11 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Hot conditions with high temperatures in the mid to upper 80s on Saturday, and low 90s on Sunday and Monday. Overnight low temperatures will likely only cool into the low 60s for many locations Saturday night and again Sunday night.
